name: Nike Art Gallery
address: 2 Elegushi Rd, Lekki Phase I, Lekki, Lagos
description: One of the largest art galleries in West Africa, showcasing a vast collection of Nigerian traditional and contemporary art.

name: Freedom Park
address: Old Prison Ground, Broad Street, Lagos Island, Lagos
description: A former colonial prison transformed into a memorial and leisure park, hosting events, concerts, and art exhibitions.

name: Eko Atlantic City
description: A new city being built on reclaimed land from the Atlantic Ocean, designed to be the financial hub of Africa.

name: Terra Kulture
address: Plot 1376, Tiamiyu Savage St, Victoria Island, Lagos
description: A leading art, culture, and lifestyle center offering a restaurant, theater, bookstore, and art gallery.

name: Lekki Conservation Centre
description: A protected natural resource center, home to a rich diversity of flora and fauna, featuring a famous canopy walkway.

name: Badagry Slave Museum
description: A poignant museum documenting the history of the transatlantic slave trade, located in a historically significant coastal town.

name: National Museum Lagos
description: Houses significant collections of Nigerian art, archaeology, and ethnography, including the famous Nok Terracottas.

name: Makoko Floating Community
description: An informal settlement built on stilts on Lagos Lagoon, showcasing unique adaptive architecture and community resilience.
